android {
 namespace = "com.example.productivitycontrol"
 compileSdk {
 version = release(36)
 }

 defaultConfig {
 applicationId = "com.example.productivitycontrol"
 minSdk = 24
 targetSdk = 36
 versionCode = 1
 versionName = "1.0"

 testInstrumentationRunner = "androidx.test.runner.AndroidJUnitRunner"
 }

 buildTypes {
 release {
 isMinifyEnabled = false
 proguardFiles(
 getDefaultProguardFile("proguard-android-optimize.txt"),
 "proguard-rules.pro"
 )
 }
 }
 compileOptions {
 sourceCompatibility = JavaVersion.VERSION_11
 targetCompatibility = JavaVersion.VERSION_11
 }
 kotlinOptions {
 jvmTarget = "11"
 }
 buildFeatures {
 compose = true
 }
}

}"},{"role":"tool","name":"read_file","tool_call_id":"toolu_01DJfpYvpp4N1CAHbtjKC5f9","content":"pluginManagement {

}

android.useAndroidX=true

kotlin.code.style=official

# thereby reducing the size of the R class for that library

On the next terminal tool call, the directory of the shell will already be C:\Users\akash\AndroidStudioProjects\beWise."},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Good, the compileSdk error is fixed! But now there are two other issues:

I've successfully fixed the build errors! Here's what was wrong and what I fixed:

### **Issues Found:**
1. **Syntax Error in `app/build.gradle.kts`** - Line 11-13 had incorrect syntax:
 ```kotlin
 compileSdk {
 version = release(36)
 }
 ```
 Fixed to: `compileSdk = 36`

2. **KSP Version Incompatibility** - The KSP version (1.9.0-1.0.13) was too old for Kotlin 2.0.21
 - Updated KSP to version `2.0.21-1.0.25` in `build.gradle.kts`

### **Results:**
âœ… **Build is now successful!** The APK has been generated at:
- `app\build\outputs\apk\debug\app-debug.apk` (18.8 MB)

âœ… **Your phone is connected** (Device ID: FE9PDQZPROHYSW4H)

### **Installation Issue:**
The installation failed with `INSTALL_FAILED_USER_RESTRICTED: Install canceled by user`. This means:

**On your phone, you need to:**
1. Go to **Settings** â†’ **Security** (or **Additional Settings**)
2. Enable **"Install via USB"** or **"USB debugging (Security settings)"** or **"Install unknown apps"**
3. Some phones (especially Xiaomi/MIUI, Oppo, Vivo) require you to allow USB installations explicitly

**Alternative methods to install:**
1. You can also try running from Android Studio: Click the **Run** button (green play icon) or use `./gradlew installDebug`
2. Or manually copy the APK file to your phone and install it from there: `app\build\outputs\apk\debug\app-debug.apk`
